intro: Apodocephala minor, commonly known as the small-headed leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its slender body and delicate wings, which are often transparent or lightly colored. This plant-feeding insect is typically found on various herbaceous plants, where it feeds on sap. Its life cycle includes egg, nymph, and adult stages, with nymphs resembling adults but lacking wings. Apodocephala minor plays a role in plant ecology through its feeding habits and interactions with natural predators.
